about_the_game:
Story

Fed up with unavoidable double ads before videos, the protagonist decides to enter a shooting game (shmup) where shooting down ads is the goal. Completing all stages promises an ad-free experience for a while, but is it really that simple?

Bosses are Advertisers from Fictional Companies

Bosses attack using their company products as bullet-hell advertisements.

Note: Objects resembling hamburgers, cars, and realtors are advertisements and not actual food, vehicles, or people.

Full Japanese Voice Acting

Voice Cast:
Kyōhei Natsume / Haruki Asada / Yūki Amezawa / Daisuke Hirakawa / Masahiro Yamanaka

Note: The English version will include Japanese audio with English subtitles.

Beginner-Friendly Shmup

Recommended even for those who usually don't play shmup.
An Easy mode is available, and you can also increase the number of continues from the settings menu.
The protagonist's life is based on an HP gauge, so you can take more hits than it seems.

Ads Aren't the Enemy

Defeating bosses earns you skills that can be used in subsequent stages.
Not shooting down ads — pausing your shots — can also prove beneficial.

Score Attack

Global score rankings are categorized by difficulty level. Advanced shooters, aim for the world's top score in Hard mode.

name: Ad SHOOt（アドシュー）

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 11 23H2
  • Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-8700K CPU @ 3.70GHz 3.70 GHz
  • Memory: 32.0 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 6GB
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 3.71 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Realtek High Definition Audio
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: A 2D vertical scrolling bullet-hell shooter game where you shoot down fictional advertisements. Features 7 stages and full Japanese voice acting.
supported_languages:
English, Japanese*, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese
*languages with full audio support
